rules.natural: Provided that the conservation team uses an electric vehicle, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Either the conservation team uses an electric vehicle or the volunteer group plants trees.
Whenever the campaign faces regulatory hurdles, it follows that the conservation team analyzes water samples.
Under the condition that the campaign meets community resistance, if the local government has approval, then the conservation team monitors air quality.
The campaign meets community resistance or it gains public support.
In the event that the campaign gains public support, given that the local government has approval, the conservation team monitors air quality.
Either the campaign expands to a new region or it does not face legal penalties.
Provided that the campaign achieves national recognition, it receives an international award.
Under the condition that the campaign achieves national recognition, it does not receive an international award.
The campaign achieves national recognition or it does not expand to a new region.
Should the volunteer group reduce carbon footprint, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
The campaign receives a grant or it has a funding cut or, provided that the volunteer group plants trees, it reduces carbon footprint.
If the conservation team monitors air quality, then it conducts soil testing.
Given that the conservation team analyzes water samples, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Either the local government has approval or the campaign faces regulatory hurdles.
If it is not the case that complying with regulations implies not violating environmental laws, then the campaign faces legal penalties.
Provided that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign violates environmental laws.
In the event that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign complies with regulations.

facts.natural: The campaign does not have a funding cut.
The campaign does not receive a grant.
The conservation team does not conduct soil testing.

steps.natural: Either the campaign has a funding cut or, if the volunteer group plants trees, it reduces carbon footprint.
If the volunteer group plants trees, then it reduces carbon footprint.
Whenever the volunteer group plants trees, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Under the condition that the local government has approval, the conservation team monitors air quality.
The conservation team monitors air quality or it analyzes water samples.
Either the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals.
The campaign does not achieve national recognition.
The campaign does not expand to a new region.
It is not the case that the campaign faces legal penalties.
If the campaign complies with regulations, then it is not the case that it violates environmental laws.
Should it not be true that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, then the campaign does not violate environmental laws.
Either the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals.

natural_facts.A4: The campaign has a funding cut.

natural_facts.A8: The conservation team analyzes water samples.
natural_facts.A16: The campaign expands to a new region.
natural_facts.A18: The campaign receives an international award.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that the conservation team uses an electric vehicle, the campaign achieves environmental goals.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either the conservation team uses an electric vehicle or the volunteer group plants trees.

(A10 → A8).natural: Whenever the campaign faces regulatory hurdles, it follows that the conservation team analyzes water samples.

(A11 → (A9 → A7)).natural: Under the condition that the campaign meets community resistance, if the local government has approval, then the conservation team monitors air quality.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: The campaign meets community resistance or it gains public support.

(A12 → (A9 → A7)).natural: In the event that the campaign gains public support, given that the local government has approval, the conservation team monitors air quality.

(A14 → ¬A13).natural: If the campaign complies with regulations, then it is not the case that it violates environmental laws.

(A16 ∨ ¬A15).natural: Either the campaign expands to a new region or it does not face legal penalties.

(A17 → A18).natural: Provided that the campaign achieves national recognition, it receives an international award.

(A17 → ¬A18).natural: Under the condition that the campaign achieves national recognition, it does not receive an international award.

(A17 ∨ ¬A16).natural: The campaign achieves national recognition or it does not expand to a new region.

(A2 → A3).natural: If the volunteer group plants trees, then it reduces carbon footprint.

(A2 → G).natural: Whenever the volunteer group plants trees, the campaign achieves environmental goals.

(A3 → G).natural: Should the volunteer group reduce carbon footprint, the campaign achieves environmental goals.

(A4 ∨ (A2 → A3)).natural: Either the campaign has a funding cut or, if the volunteer group plants trees, it reduces carbon footprint.

(A5 ∨ (A4 ∨ (A2 → A3))).natural: The campaign receives a grant or it has a funding cut or, provided that the volunteer group plants trees, it reduces carbon footprint.

(A6 ∨ G).natural: Either the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals.

(A7 → A6).natural: If the conservation team monitors air quality, then it conducts soil testing.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: The conservation team monitors air quality or it analyzes water samples.

(A8 → G).natural: Given that the conservation team analyzes water samples, the campaign achieves environmental goals.

(A9 → A7).natural: Under the condition that the local government has approval, the conservation team monitors air quality.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: Either the local government has approval or the campaign faces regulatory hurdles.

(¬(A14 → ¬A13) → A15).natural: If it is not the case that complying with regulations implies not violating environmental laws, then the campaign faces legal penalties.

(¬(A6 ∨ G) → A13).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign violates environmental laws.

(¬(A6 ∨ G) → A14).natural: In the event that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign complies with regulations.

(¬(A6 ∨ G) → ¬A13).natural: Should it not be true that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, then the campaign does not violate environmental laws.

¬A16.natural: The campaign does not expand to a new region.
